db:abstract.db:para: The QByteArrayView class provides a view on an array of bytes with a read-only subset of the QByteArray API.
This class was introduced in Qt 6.0.

db:note.db:para: All functions in this class are reentrant.

db:abstract.db:para: This class is strongly comparable with QByteArray and const char *.
This class is strongly comparable with QString, QStringView, QUtf8StringView, QLatin1StringView, QChar, and char16_t.
When comparing with string and Unicode character types, the content is interpreted as UTF-8.

db:listitem.db:para: QByteArrayView is part of toolsImplicitly Shared Classesstring-processing

db:section.db:title: Detailed Description
db:section.db:para: A QByteArrayView references a contiguous portion of raw bytes it does not own. It acts as an interface type to all kinds of byte-array-like data, without the need to construct a QByteArray first.
The byte array data may be represented as an array (or an array-compatible data-structure such as QByteArray, std::basic_string, etc.) of char, signed char, unsigned char or std::byte.

QByteArrayView is designed as an interface type; its main use-case is as a function parameter type. When QByteArrayViews are used as automatic variables or data members, care must be taken to ensure that the referenced data (for example, owned by a QByteArray) outlives the QByteArrayView on all code paths, lest the byte array view ends up referencing deleted data.

When used as an interface type, QByteArrayView allows a single function to accept a wide variety of byte-array-like data sources. One function accepting QByteArrayView thus replaces several function overloads (taking, for example, QByteArray, const char *, etc.) while at the same time enabling even more byte array data sources to be passed to the function.
QByteArrayView should be passed by value, not by reference-to-const:
db:section.db:programlisting: void myfun1(QByteArrayView bv); // preferred void myfun2(const QByteArrayView &bv); // compiles and works, but slower
db:section.db:para: If you want to give your users maximum freedom in what type of data they can pass to your function, accompany the QByteArrayView overload with overloads for

db:listitem.db:para: char: this overload can delegate to the QByteArrayView version:
db:listitem.db:programlisting: void fun(QByteArrayView bv); void fun(char ch) { fun(QByteArrayView(&ch, 1)); }
db:listitem.db:para: even though, for technical reasons, QByteArrayView cannot provide a char constructor by itself.
QByteArray: if you store an unmodified copy of the byte array and thus would like to take advantage of QByteArray's implicit sharing.

db:section.db:para: QByteArrayView can also be used as the return value of a function. If you call a function returning QByteArrayView, take extra care to not keep the QByteArrayView around longer than the function promises to keep the referenced data alive. If in doubt, obtain a strong reference to the data by calling toByteArray() to convert the QByteArrayView into a QByteArray.

The methods supported by QByteArrayView reflect those of QByteArray. In particular, to the limited degree that it ascribes semantics (such as character case, spacing, digits of numbers) to the character data viewed, it uses the C locale and ASCII encoding. See C locale and ASCII functions for details and the limitations on these methods.

db:section.db:title: Compatible Byte Types
db:section.db:para: QByteArrayView can be constructed on any container of bytes, where the byte type is one of:

db:section.db:title: QByteArrayView::const_iterator
db:section.db:para: This typedef provides an STL-style const iterator for QByteArrayView.

db:section.db:title: QByteArrayView::const_pointer
db:section.db:para: Alias for value_type *. Provided for compatibility with the STL.

db:section.db:title: QByteArrayView::const_reference
db:section.db:para: Alias for value_type &. Provided for compatibility with the STL.

db:section.db:title: QByteArrayView::const_reverse_iterator
db:section.db:para: This typedef provides an STL-style const reverse iterator for QByteArrayView.

db:section.db:title: QByteArrayView::difference_type
db:section.db:para: Alias for std::ptrdiff_t. Provided for compatibility with the STL.

db:section.db:title: QByteArrayView::iterator
db:section.db:para: This typedef provides an STL-style const iterator for QByteArrayView.
QByteArrayView does not support mutable iterators, so this is the same as const_iterator.

db:section.db:title: QByteArrayView::pointer
db:section.db:para: Alias for value_type *. Provided for compatibility with the STL.
QByteArrayView does not support mutable pointers, so this is the same as const_pointer.

db:section.db:title: QByteArrayView::reference
db:section.db:para: Alias for value_type &. Provided for compatibility with the STL.
QByteArrayView does not support mutable references, so this is the same as const_reference.

db:section.db:title: QByteArrayView::reverse_iterator
db:section.db:para: This typedef provides an STL-style const reverse iterator for QByteArrayView.
QByteArrayView does not support mutable reverse iterators, so this is the same as const_reverse_iterator.

db:section.db:title: QByteArrayView::size_type
db:section.db:para: Alias for qsizetype. Provided for compatibility with the STL.

db:section.db:title: QByteArrayView::storage_type
db:section.db:para: Alias for char.

db:section.db:title: QByteArrayView::value_type
db:section.db:para: Alias for const char. Provided for compatibility with the STL.

db:section.db:title: [noexcept] bool QByteArrayView::startsWith(QByteArrayView bv) const
db:section.db:para: Returns true if this byte array view starts with byte array view bv or character ch, respectively; otherwise returns false.

db:section.db:title: [noexcept] bool QByteArrayView::endsWith(QByteArrayView bv) const
db:section.db:para: Returns true if this byte array view ends with byte array view bv or character ch, respectively; otherwise returns false.

db:section.db:title: [noexcept] qsizetype QByteArrayView::indexOf(QByteArrayView bv, qsizetype from = 0) const
db:section.db:bridgehead: [noexcept] qsizetype QByteArrayView::indexOf(char ch, qsizetype from = 0) const
db:section.db:para: Returns the index position of either the start of the first occurrence of the sequence of bytes viewed by bv or the first occurrence of byte ch, respectively, in this byte array view, searching forward from index position from.Returns -1 if no match is found.
If from is -1, the search starts at the last character; if it is -2, at the next to last character and so on.

db:section.db:title: [noexcept] bool QByteArrayView::contains(QByteArrayView bv) const
db:section.db:para: Returns true if this byte array view contains an occurrence of the sequence of bytes viewed by bv or character ch, respectively; otherwise returns false.

db:section.db:title: [noexcept] qsizetype QByteArrayView::lastIndexOf(QByteArrayView bv, qsizetype from) const
db:section.db:bridgehead: [noexcept] qsizetype QByteArrayView::lastIndexOf(char ch, qsizetype from = -1) const
db:section.db:para: Returns the index position of either the start of the last occurrence of the sequence of bytes viewed by bv or the last occurrence of byte ch, respectively, in this byte array view, searching backward from index position from.
If from is -1, the search starts at the last character; if it is -2, at the next to last character and so on.
Returns -1 if no match is found.

db:note.db:para: When searching for a 0-length bv, the match at the end of the data is excluded from the search by a negative from, even though -1 is normally thought of as searching from the end of the view: the match at the end is after the last character, so it is excluded. To include such a final empty match, either give a positive value for from or omit the from parameter entirely.

db:section.db:title: [constexpr noexcept] QByteArrayView::QByteArrayView()
db:section.db:para: Constructs a null byte array view.

db:section.db:title: [constexpr noexcept] QByteArrayView::QByteArrayView(const Byte *data)
db:section.db:para: Constructs a byte array view on data. The length is determined by scanning for the first Byte(0).
data must remain valid for the lifetime of this byte array view object.
Passing nullptr as data is safe and results in a null byte array view.
This constructor only participates in overload resolution if data is not an array and if Byte is a compatible byte type.

db:section.db:title: [constexpr noexcept] QByteArrayView::QByteArrayView(const Container &c)
db:section.db:para: Constructs a byte array view on the array-like container c. The length and data are set via std::size(c) and std::data(c) respectively.
The container's data must remain valid for the lifetime of this byte array view object.
This constructor participates in overload resolution if c is any contiguous container with elements of a compatible byte type.

db:section.db:title: [noexcept] QByteArrayView::QByteArrayView(const QByteArray &byteArray)
db:section.db:para: Constructs a byte array view on byteArray.
byteArray.data() must remain valid for the lifetime of this byte array view object.
The byte array view will be null if and only if byteArray.isNull().

db:section.db:title: [constexpr noexcept] QByteArrayView::QByteArrayView(const char (&)[Size] data)
db:section.db:para: Constructs a byte array view on the char array data. The view covers the array until the first '\0' is encountered, or Size, whichever comes first. If you need the full array, use fromArray() instead.
data must remain valid for the lifetime of this byte array view object.

db:note.db:para: This constructor is only available for char array literals. The reasoning behind that is for compatibility with C-libraries which predefine "large-enough" arrays, but only use some of the preallocated space. To support this in an intuitive way in an implicit constructor overload, we need to stop at the first char(0). This is logical for a char array, but not for a std::byte array.

db:section.db:title: [constexpr noexcept] QByteArrayView::QByteArrayView(std::nullptr_t)
db:section.db:para: Constructs a null byte array view.

db:section.db:title: [constexpr] QByteArrayView::QByteArrayView(const Byte *first, const Byte *last)
db:section.db:para: Constructs a byte array view on first with length (last - first).
The range [first,last) must remain valid for the lifetime of this QByteArrayView.
Passing \nullptr as first is safe if last is nullptr, too, and results in a null byte array view.
The behavior is undefined if last precedes first, or first is nullptr and last is not.
This constructor only participates in overload resolution if Byte is a compatible byte type.

db:section.db:title: [constexpr] QByteArrayView::QByteArrayView(const Byte *data, qsizetype len)
db:section.db:para: Constructs a byte array view on data with length len.
The range [data,len) must remain valid for the lifetime of this QByteArrayView.
Passing nullptr as data is safe if len is 0, too, and results in a null byte array view.
The behavior is undefined if len is negative or, when positive, if data is nullptr.
This constructor only participates in overload resolution if Byte is a compatible byte type.

db:section.db:title: [constexpr] char QByteArrayView::at(qsizetype n) const
db:section.db:para: Returns the character at position n in this byte array view.
The behavior is undefined if n is negative or not less than size().

db:section.db:title: [constexpr] char QByteArrayView::back() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the last byte in the byte array view.
This function is provided for STL compatibility.

db:warning.db:para: Calling this function on an empty byte array view constitutes undefined behavior.

db:section.db:title: [constexpr noexcept] QByteArrayView::const_iterator QByteArrayView::begin() const
db:section.db:para: Returns a const STL-style iterator pointing to the first byte in the byte array view.
This function is provided for STL compatibility.

db:section.db:title: [constexpr noexcept] QByteArrayView::const_iterator QByteArrayView::cbegin() const
db:section.db:para: Same as begin().
This function is provided for STL compatibility.

db:section.db:title: [constexpr noexcept] QByteArrayView::const_iterator QByteArrayView::cend() const
db:section.db:para: Same as end().
This function is provided for STL compatibility.

db:section.db:title: [constexpr] void QByteArrayView::chop(qsizetype length)
db:section.db:para: Truncates this byte array view by length characters.
Same as *this = first(size() - length).

db:note.db:para: The behavior is undefined when length < 0 or length > size().

db:section.db:title: [constexpr] QByteArrayView QByteArrayView::chopped(qsizetype length) const
db:section.db:para: Returns a copy of this byte array view that omits its last length bytes. In other words, returns a byte array view of length size() - length starting at the beginning of this object.
Same as first(size() - length).

db:note.db:para: The behavior is undefined when length < 0 or length > size().

db:section.db:title: [noexcept, since 6.2] int QByteArrayView::compare(QByteArrayView bv, Qt::CaseSensitivity cs = Qt::CaseSensitive) const
db:section.db:para: Returns an integer less than, equal to, or greater than zero depending on whether this QByteArrayView sorts before, at the same position as, or after the QByteArrayView bv. The comparison is performed according to case sensitivity cs.
This function was introduced in Qt 6.2.

db:section.db:title: [constexpr noexcept] QByteArrayView::const_pointer QByteArrayView::constData() const
db:section.db:para: Returns a const char pointer to the first byte in the byte array view.

db:note.db:para: The character array represented by the return value is not guaranteed to be null-terminated. The returned pointer is only safe to use for accessing bytes at indices that are less than this byte array view's size().

db:section.db:title: [noexcept] qsizetype QByteArrayView::count(QByteArrayView bv) const
db:section.db:para: Returns the number of (potentially overlapping) occurrences of the sequence of bytes viewed by bv in this byte array view.

db:section.db:title: [noexcept] qsizetype QByteArrayView::count(char ch) const
db:section.db:para: This is an overloaded function.
Returns the number of occurrences of byte ch in this byte array view.

db:section.db:title: [constexpr noexcept] QByteArrayView::const_reverse_iterator QByteArrayView::crbegin() const
db:section.db:para: Same as rbegin().
This function is provided for STL compatibility.

db:section.db:title: [constexpr noexcept] QByteArrayView::const_reverse_iterator QByteArrayView::crend() const
db:section.db:para: Same as rend().
This function is provided for STL compatibility.

db:section.db:title: [constexpr noexcept] QByteArrayView::const_pointer QByteArrayView::data() const
db:section.db:para: Returns a const char pointer to the first byte in the byte array view.

db:note.db:para: The character array represented by the return value is not guaranteed to be null-terminated. The returned pointer is only safe to use for accessing bytes at indices that are less than this byte array view's size().

db:section.db:title: [constexpr noexcept] bool QByteArrayView::empty() const
db:section.db:para: Returns true if this byte array view is empty - that is, size() == 0.
This function is provided for STL compatibility.

db:section.db:title: [constexpr noexcept] QByteArrayView::const_iterator QByteArrayView::end() const
db:section.db:para: Returns a const STL-style iterator pointing just after the last byte in the byte array view.
This function is provided for STL compatibility.

db:section.db:title: [constexpr] QByteArrayView QByteArrayView::first(qsizetype n) const
db:section.db:para: Returns a byte array view that points to the first n bytes of this byte array view. Equivalent to sliced(0, n).

db:note.db:para: The behavior is undefined when n < 0 or n > size().

db:section.db:title: [static constexpr noexcept] QByteArrayView QByteArrayView::fromArray(const Byte (&)[Size] data)
db:section.db:para: Constructs a byte array view on the array literal data. The view covers the full array. That includes the trailing null-terminator of char array literals. If you don't want the null-terminator included in the view, you can chop() it off when you are certain it is at the end. Alternatively you can use the constructor overload taking a char array literal which will create a view up to, but not including, the first null-terminator in the data.
This function will work with any array literal of a compatible byte type.

db:section.db:title: [constexpr] char QByteArrayView::front() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the first byte in the byte array view.
This function is provided for STL compatibility.

db:warning.db:para: Calling this function on an empty byte array view constitutes undefined behavior.

db:section.db:title: [constexpr noexcept] bool QByteArrayView::isEmpty() const
db:section.db:para: Returns true if this byte array view is empty - that is, size() == 0.

db:section.db:title: [constexpr noexcept] bool QByteArrayView::isNull() const
db:section.db:para: Returns true if this byte array view is null - that is, data() == nullptr.

db:section.db:title: [noexcept, since 6.3] bool QByteArrayView::isValidUtf8() const
db:section.db:para: Returns true if this byte array view contains valid UTF-8 encoded data, or false otherwise.
This function was introduced in Qt 6.3.

db:section.db:title: [constexpr] QByteArrayView QByteArrayView::last(qsizetype n) const
db:section.db:para: Returns a byte array view that points to the last n bytes of this byte array view.

db:note.db:para: The behavior is undefined when n < 0 or n > size().

db:section.db:title: [noexcept, since 6.2] qsizetype QByteArrayView::lastIndexOf(QByteArrayView bv) const
db:section.db:para: This is an overloaded function.

Returns the index position of the start of the last occurrence of the sequence of bytes viewed by bv in this byte array view, searching backward from the end of this byte array view. Returns -1 if no match is found.
This function was introduced in Qt 6.2.

db:section.db:title: [constexpr noexcept] qsizetype QByteArrayView::length() const
db:section.db:para: Same as size().

db:section.db:title: [static constexpr noexcept, since 6.8] qsizetype QByteArrayView::maxSize()
db:section.db:para: It returns the maximum number of elements that the view can theoretically represent. In practice, the number can be much smaller, limited by the amount of memory available to the system.
This function was introduced in Qt 6.8.

db:section.db:title: [constexpr noexcept, since 6.8] qsizetype QByteArrayView::max_size() const
db:section.db:para: This function is provided for STL compatibility.
Returns maxSize().
This function was introduced in Qt 6.8.

db:section.db:title: [constexpr noexcept] QByteArrayView::const_reverse_iterator QByteArrayView::rbegin() const
db:section.db:para: Returns a const STL-style reverse iterator pointing to the first byte in the byte array view, in reverse order.
This function is provided for STL compatibility.

db:section.db:title: [constexpr noexcept] QByteArrayView::const_reverse_iterator QByteArrayView::rend() const
db:section.db:para: Returns a STL-style reverse iterator pointing to one past the last byte in the byte array view, in reverse order.
This function is provided for STL compatibility.

db:section.db:title: [constexpr noexcept] qsizetype QByteArrayView::size() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the number of bytes in this byte array view.

db:section.db:title: [constexpr, since 6.8] QByteArrayView &QByteArrayView::slice(qsizetype pos, qsizetype n)
db:section.db:para: Modifies this byte array view to start at position pos, extending for n bytes.

db:note.db:para: The behavior is undefined when pos < 0, n < 0, or pos + n > size().

db:section.db:para: This function was introduced in Qt 6.8.

db:section.db:title: [constexpr, since 6.8] QByteArrayView &QByteArrayView::slice(qsizetype pos)
db:section.db:para: This is an overloaded function.
Modifies this byte array view to start at position pos, extending to its end.

db:note.db:para: The behavior is undefined when pos < 0 or pos > size().

db:section.db:para: This function was introduced in Qt 6.8.

db:section.db:title: [constexpr] QByteArrayView QByteArrayView::sliced(qsizetype pos) const
db:section.db:para: Returns a byte array view starting at position pos in this object, and extending to its end.

db:note.db:para: The behavior is undefined when pos < 0 or pos > size().

db:section.db:title: [constexpr] QByteArrayView QByteArrayView::sliced(qsizetype pos, qsizetype n) const
db:section.db:para: Returns a byte array view that points to n bytes of this byte array view, starting at position pos.

db:note.db:para: The behavior is undefined when pos < 0, n < 0, or pos + n > size().

db:section.db:title: QByteArray QByteArrayView::toByteArray() const
db:section.db:para: Returns a deep copy of this byte array view's data as a QByteArray.
The return value will be a null QByteArray if and only if this byte array view is null.

db:section.db:title: [since 6.3] double QByteArrayView::toDouble(bool *ok = nullptr) const
db:section.db:para: Returns this byte array view converted to a double value.
Returns an infinity if the conversion overflows or 0.0 if the conversion fails for other reasons (e.g. underflow).
If ok is not nullptr, failure is reported by setting *ok to false, and success by setting *ok to true.

db:warning.db:para: The QByteArrayView content may only contain valid numerical characters which includes the plus/minus sign, the character e used in scientific notation, and the decimal point. Including the unit or additional characters leads to a conversion error.

db:note.db:para: The conversion of the number is performed in the default C locale, regardless of the user's locale. Use QLocale to perform locale-aware conversions between numbers and strings.

db:section.db:para: This function ignores leading and trailing spacing characters.
This function was introduced in Qt 6.3.

db:section.db:title: [since 6.3] float QByteArrayView::toFloat(bool *ok = nullptr) const
db:section.db:para: Returns this byte array view converted to a float value.
Returns an infinity if the conversion overflows or 0.0 if the conversion fails for other reasons (e.g. underflow).
If ok is not nullptr, failure is reported by setting *ok to false, and success by setting *ok to true.

db:warning.db:para: The QByteArrayView content may only contain valid numerical characters which includes the plus/minus sign, the character e used in scientific notation, and the decimal point. Including the unit or additional characters leads to a conversion error.

db:note.db:para: The conversion of the number is performed in the default C locale, regardless of the user's locale. Use QLocale to perform locale-aware conversions between numbers and strings.

db:section.db:para: This function ignores leading and trailing whitespace.
This function was introduced in Qt 6.3.

db:section.db:title: [since 6.3] int QByteArrayView::toInt(bool *ok = nullptr, int base = 10) const
db:section.db:para: Returns this byte array view converted to an int using base base, which is ten by default. Bases 0 and 2 through 36 are supported, using letters for digits beyond 9; A is ten, B is eleven and so on.

If base is 0, the base is determined automatically using the following rules: if the byte array view begins with "0x", the rest of it is read as hexadecimal (base 16); otherwise, if it begins with "0", the rest of it is read as octal (base 8); otherwise it is read as decimal.
Returns 0 if the conversion fails.
If ok is not nullptr, failure is reported by setting *ok to false, and success by setting *ok to true.

db:note.db:para: The conversion of the number is performed in the default C locale, regardless of the user's locale. Use QLocale to perform locale-aware conversions between numbers and strings.

db:section.db:para: This function was introduced in Qt 6.3.

db:section.db:title: [since 6.3] long QByteArrayView::toLong(bool *ok = nullptr, int base = 10) const
db:section.db:para: Returns this byte array view converted to a long int using base base, which is ten by default. Bases 0 and 2 through 36 are supported, using letters for digits beyond 9; A is ten, B is eleven and so on.

If base is 0, the base is determined automatically using the following rules: if the byte array view begins with "0x", the rest of it is read as hexadecimal (base 16); otherwise, if it begins with "0", the rest of it is read as octal (base 8); otherwise it is read as decimal.
Returns 0 if the conversion fails.
If ok is not nullptr, failure is reported by setting *ok to false, and success by setting *ok to true.

db:note.db:para: The conversion of the number is performed in the default C locale, regardless of the user's locale. Use QLocale to perform locale-aware conversions between numbers and strings.

db:section.db:para: This function was introduced in Qt 6.3.

db:section.db:title: [since 6.3] qlonglong QByteArrayView::toLongLong(bool *ok = nullptr, int base = 10) const
db:section.db:para: Returns this byte array view converted to a long long using base base, which is ten by default. Bases 0 and 2 through 36 are supported, using letters for digits beyond 9; A is ten, B is eleven and so on.

If base is 0, the base is determined automatically using the following rules: if the byte array view begins with "0x", the rest of it is read as hexadecimal (base 16); otherwise, if it begins with "0", the rest of it is read as octal (base 8); otherwise it is read as decimal.
Returns 0 if the conversion fails.
If ok is not nullptr, failure is reported by setting *ok to false, and success by setting *ok to true.

db:note.db:para: The conversion of the number is performed in the default C locale, regardless of the user's locale. Use QLocale to perform locale-aware conversions between numbers and strings.

db:section.db:para: This function was introduced in Qt 6.3.

db:section.db:title: [since 6.3] short QByteArrayView::toShort(bool *ok = nullptr, int base = 10) const
db:section.db:para: Returns this byte array view converted to a short using base base, which is ten by default. Bases 0 and 2 through 36 are supported, using letters for digits beyond 9; A is ten, B is eleven and so on.

If base is 0, the base is determined automatically using the following rules: if the byte array view begins with "0x", the rest of it is read as hexadecimal (base 16); otherwise, if it begins with "0", the rest of it is read as octal (base 8); otherwise it is read as decimal.
Returns 0 if the conversion fails.
If ok is not nullptr, failure is reported by setting *ok to false, and success by setting *ok to true.

db:note.db:para: The conversion of the number is performed in the default C locale, regardless of the user's locale. Use QLocale to perform locale-aware conversions between numbers and strings.

db:section.db:para: This function was introduced in Qt 6.3.

db:section.db:title: [since 6.3] uint QByteArrayView::toUInt(bool *ok = nullptr, int base = 10) const
db:section.db:para: Returns this byte array view converted to an unsigned int using base base, which is ten by default. Bases 0 and 2 through 36 are supported, using letters for digits beyond 9; A is ten, B is eleven and so on.

If base is 0, the base is determined automatically using the following rules: if the byte array view begins with "0x", the rest of it is read as hexadecimal (base 16); otherwise, if it begins with "0", the rest of it is read as octal (base 8); otherwise it is read as decimal.
Returns 0 if the conversion fails.
If ok is not nullptr, failure is reported by setting *ok to false, and success by setting *ok to true.

db:note.db:para: The conversion of the number is performed in the default C locale, regardless of the user's locale. Use QLocale to perform locale-aware conversions between numbers and strings.

db:section.db:para: This function was introduced in Qt 6.3.

db:section.db:title: [since 6.3] ulong QByteArrayView::toULong(bool *ok = nullptr, int base = 10) const
db:section.db:para: Returns this byte array view converted to an unsigned long int using base base, which is ten by default. Bases 0 and 2 through 36 are supported, using letters for digits beyond 9; A is ten, B is eleven and so on.

If base is 0, the base is determined automatically using the following rules: if the byte array view begins with "0x", the rest of it is read as hexadecimal (base 16); otherwise, if it begins with "0", the rest of it is read as octal (base 8); otherwise it is read as decimal.
Returns 0 if the conversion fails.
If ok is not nullptr, failure is reported by setting *ok to false, and success by setting *ok to true.

db:note.db:para: The conversion of the number is performed in the default C locale, regardless of the user's locale. Use QLocale to perform locale-aware conversions between numbers and strings.

db:section.db:para: This function was introduced in Qt 6.3.

db:section.db:title: [since 6.3] qulonglong QByteArrayView::toULongLong(bool *ok = nullptr, int base = 10) const
db:section.db:para: Returns this byte array view converted to an unsigned long long using base base, which is ten by default. Bases 0 and 2 through 36 are supported, using letters for digits beyond 9; A is ten, B is eleven and so on.

If base is 0, the base is determined automatically using the following rules: if the byte array view begins with "0x", the rest of it is read as hexadecimal (base 16); otherwise, if it begins with "0", the rest of it is read as octal (base 8); otherwise it is read as decimal.
Returns 0 if the conversion fails.
If ok is not nullptr, failure is reported by setting *ok to false, and success by setting *ok to true.

db:note.db:para: The conversion of the number is performed in the default C locale, regardless of the user's locale. Use QLocale to perform locale-aware conversions between numbers and strings.

db:section.db:para: This function was introduced in Qt 6.3.

db:section.db:title: [since 6.3] ushort QByteArrayView::toUShort(bool *ok = nullptr, int base = 10) const
db:section.db:para: Returns this byte array view converted to an unsigned short using base base, which is ten by default. Bases 0 and 2 through 36 are supported, using letters for digits beyond 9; A is ten, B is eleven and so on.

If base is 0, the base is determined automatically using the following rules: if the byte array view begins with "0x", the rest of it is read as hexadecimal (base 16); otherwise, if it begins with "0", the rest of it is read as octal (base 8); otherwise it is read as decimal.
Returns 0 if the conversion fails.
If ok is not nullptr, failure is reported by setting *ok to false, and success by setting *ok to true.

db:note.db:para: The conversion of the number is performed in the default C locale, regardless of the user's locale. Use QLocale to perform locale-aware conversions between numbers and strings.

db:section.db:para: This function was introduced in Qt 6.3.

db:section.db:title: [noexcept, since 6.3] QByteArrayView QByteArrayView::trimmed() const
db:section.db:para: Returns a copy of this byte array view with spacing characters removed from the start and end.

The spacing characters are those for which the standard C++ isspace() function returns true in the C locale; these are the ASCII characters tabulation '\t', line feed '\n', carriage return '\r', vertical tabulation '\v', form feed '\f', and space ' '.
This function was introduced in Qt 6.3.

db:section.db:title: [constexpr] void QByteArrayView::truncate(qsizetype length)
db:section.db:para: Truncates this byte array view to length length.
Same as *this = first(length).

db:note.db:para: The behavior is undefined when length < 0 or length > size().

db:section.db:title: [constexpr noexcept, since 6.7] std::string_view QByteArrayView::operator std::string_view() const
db:section.db:para: Converts this QByteArrayView object to a std::string_view object. The returned view will have the same data pointer and length of this view.
This function was introduced in Qt 6.7.

db:section.db:title: [constexpr] char QByteArrayView::operator[](qsizetype n) const
db:section.db:para: Returns the character at position n in this byte array view.
The behavior is undefined if n is negative or not less than size().

db:section.db:title: [noexcept] bool operator!=(const QByteArrayView &lhs, const QByteArrayView &rhs)
db:section.db:para: Comparison operators for QByteArrayView.

db:section.db:title: Obsolete Members for QByteArrayView
db:section.db:para: The following members of class QByteArrayView are deprecated. We strongly advise against using them in new code.

db:section.db:title: [constexpr, since 6.5, deprecated] QByteArrayView QByteArrayView::left(qsizetype length) const
db:section.db:para: This function is deprecated. We strongly advise against using it in new code.
Use first() instead in new code.
Returns the subarray of length length starting at position 0 in this object.
The entire byte array view is returned if length is greater than or equal to size(), or less than zero.
This function was introduced in Qt 6.5.

db:section.db:title: [constexpr, since 6.5, deprecated] QByteArrayView QByteArrayView::mid(qsizetype start, qsizetype length = -1) const
db:section.db:para: This function is deprecated. We strongly advise against using it in new code.
Use sliced() instead in new code.
Returns the subarray of length length starting at position start in this object.

Returns an empty byte array view if start exceeds the length of the byte array view. If there are less than length characters available in the byte array view starting at start, or if length is negative (default), the function returns all characters that are available from start.
This function was introduced in Qt 6.5.

db:section.db:title: [constexpr, since 6.5, deprecated] QByteArrayView QByteArrayView::right(qsizetype length) const
db:section.db:para: This function is deprecated. We strongly advise against using it in new code.
Use last() instead in new code.
Returns the subarray of length length starting at position size() - length in this object.
The entire byte array view is returned if length is greater than or equal to size(), or less than zero.
This function was introduced in Qt 6.5.
